events.message: The customer reported a car collision that occurred at a traffic intersection involving their vehicle and another party.
The claim was categorized under Auto Accident after reviewing the initial report and verifying keywords such as vehicle and collision.
An insurance agent was assigned promptly to handle the case and guide the customer through the claim process.
The claim was formally acknowledged, and the customer was informed about the next steps and required documentation.
The customer was requested to provide a police report, photographs of the damaged vehicle, and a copy of their driving license.
The customer submitted all the required documents including police reports and photos which help in advancing the investigation process.
An investigation into the details and circumstances of the vehicle collision was initiated by the claims department.
The investigation concluded that the accident was caused due to a third-party vehicle running a red light.
A settlement offer covering repair costs and medical bills was proposed to the customer based on the assessment results.
Customer expressed satisfaction with the transparency and fairness of the settlement proposal presented by the agent.
The claim was officially approved by the insurance company following the customerâ€™s acceptance of the settlement terms.
Insurance payment was issued promptly to cover the vehicle repair and ensure no further inconvenience to the customer.
The insurance claim was officially closed after all settlements were paid and customer satisfaction was confirmed.
